Array.String: Everyone on board a small boat should wear a personal flotation device (PFD).
Make sure your boat has emergency equipment (flares, first aid kit etc).
Never go boating alone.
Know the limitations of the boat and do not overload it.
Follow the boating traffic rules.
Check weather conditions, and continue to monitor weather reports.
Always leave word of destination and estimated time of return.
Keep the boat away from swimming areas, rocks and other craft.
Stow all gear safely.
Always swim with a friend, never alone.
If bad weather threatens, head for shore.

env:QuestionItem.name: Overloaded boat
env:QuestionItem.message: Know the limitations of your boat and do not over load it

env:QuestionItem.name: Untidy boat
env:QuestionItem.message: Stow all gear safely

env:QuestionItem.name: No life jacket
env:QuestionItem.message: Everyone on board should wear a PFD

env:QuestionItem.name: Boat heading for rocks
env:QuestionItem.message: Keep the boat away from swimming areas, rocks and other boats

env:QuestionItem.name: Boating alone
env:QuestionItem.message: Never go boating alone

env:QuestionItem.name: Wearing a life jacket
env:QuestionItem.message: Everyone on board should wear a PFD

env:QuestionItem.name: All passengers wearing a life jacket
env:QuestionItem.message: Everyone on board should wear a PFD

env:QuestionItem.name: Safety equipment on boat
env:QuestionItem.message: Make sure your boat has emergency equipment

env:QuestionItem.name: Swimming with friends
env:QuestionItem.message: Always swim with a friend, never alone

env:QuestionItem.name: Wearing sunscreen
env:QuestionItem.message: Always use sun protection

Array.String: Obey signs giving advice to swimmers.
Listen to the pool lifeguards.
Stay away from the deep end, unless you can swim well.
Make sure the water is clear of swimmers before jumping in.
Play safely.
Do not run around the pool edge.
Check the depth markings on the poolside before diving.
Young swimmers should wear floatation devices and be supervised by an adult

env:QuestionItem.name: Young Beanie swimming alone
env:QuestionItem.message: Always swim with a friend, never alone

env:QuestionItem.name: Head first down slide
env:QuestionItem.message: Always play safely

env:QuestionItem.name: Diving in a no diving zone
env:QuestionItem.message: Obey signs giving advice to swimmers

env:QuestionItem.name: Jumping into a crowd
env:QuestionItem.message: Make sure that the water is clear of swimmers before diving in

env:QuestionItem.name: Diving into shallow water
env:QuestionItem.message: Check the depth markings on the poolside before diving

env:QuestionItem.name: Safety fence on pool
env:QuestionItem.message: Fence home pools and include self-closing gates

env:QuestionItem.name: Safety signs
env:QuestionItem.message: Always read The Surf Conditions Board

env:QuestionItem.name: Floatation device on a young swimmer
env:QuestionItem.message: Uncertain swimmers should always wear floatation devices

env:QuestionItem.name: Sunscreen
env:QuestionItem.message: Always use sun protection

Array.String: The safest place to swim at the beach is between the red and yellow flags.
Mark a reference point on the shore, to avoid drifting.
Always read The Surf Conditions Board.
If you think conditions are too rough for you, don't go in.
Always swim with a friend, never alone.
Swim parallel to and not away from the shore when you swim long distances.
Swim in well lit areas, so you can be seen if you get into trouble.
For your safety, leave the water immediately when requested by a lifeguard.
When fishing from rocks stay away from sloping, slippery edges.

env:QuestionItem.name: Swimming outside of flags
env:QuestionItem.message: The safest place to swim at the beach is between the red and yellow flags

env:QuestionItem.name: Swim parallel to shore
env:QuestionItem.message: Swim parallel to and not away from the shore when you swim long distances

env:QuestionItem.name: Rock fishing on slippery ledge
env:QuestionItem.message: When rock fishing stay away from sloping, slippery edges

env:QuestionItem.name: Diving into a group
env:QuestionItem.message: Make sure that the water is clear of swimmers before jumping in

env:QuestionItem.name: Surfing near a crowd
env:QuestionItem.message: Make sure that the water is clear of swimmers

env:QuestionItem.name: Swimming within the flags
env:QuestionItem.message: The safest place to swim at the beach is between the red and yellow flags

env:QuestionItem.name: Swimming with a friend
env:QuestionItem.message: Always swim with a friend, never alone

env:QuestionItem.name: Floatation device on a young swimmer
env:QuestionItem.message: Uncertain swimmers should always wear floatation devices

env:QuestionItem.name: Sunscreen
env:QuestionItem.message: Always use sun protection

env:QuestionItem.name: Swimming alone
env:QuestionItem.message: Always swim with a friend, never alone

Array.String: Supervise children in, on or near water.
Fence home pools and include self-closing gates.
Keep the bath plug out of reach of small children.
Never leave children alone in the bath.
Keep liquid filled buckets out of reach of children.
Empty children's paddling pools as soon as they have finished using them.
Close top loading washing machines.
Keep fish ponds covered.
Install rigid covers over spas.

env:QuestionItem.name: Young beanie unsupervised in bath
env:QuestionItem.message: Never leave children alone in the bath

env:QuestionItem.name: Paddle pool filled with water
env:QuestionItem.message: Empty children’s paddling pool as soon as they are finished using them

env:QuestionItem.name: Running near pool
env:QuestionItem.message: Do not run around the pool edge

env:QuestionItem.name: Sunscreen
env:QuestionItem.message: Always wear sun protection

env:QuestionItem.name: Young beanie being supervised in pool area
env:QuestionItem.message: Supervise children in or near water

env:QuestionItem.name: Chemicals near pool
env:QuestionItem.message: Never leave pool chemical where children can reach them

env:QuestionItem.name: Floatation device on young beanie
env:QuestionItem.message: Uncertain swimmers should always wear floatation devices

env:QuestionItem.name: Fenced pool
env:QuestionItem.message: Fence pools and included self-closing gates

env:QuestionItem.name: Covered spa
env:QuestionItem.message: Always keep spas covered when not in use
